title: Metro Briefing New York: Bronx: 2 Arrested In Immigrant Fraud
body:
Two men, one a minister, have been charged with stealing more than $260,000 from illegal immigrants by 
telling the immigrants that they could get them green cards, said Robert T. Johnson, the Bronx district attorney, 
left. 

The men, the Rev. Errol O'Connor, 48, of the Bronx, and Emanuel Felder, 33, of Uniondale, N.Y., were arrested 
on Tuesday and face grand larceny and other charges. Prosecutors say that Mr. O'Connor, of the Pentecostal 
Deliverance Ministries in the Bronx, falsely claimed in radio commercials that he could obtain resident alien status 
for immigrants for a fee, which averaged about $4,000.   Richard Lezin Jones (NYT)
